intro: Peyritschia howellii, commonly known as the Howell's peyritschia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in a cluster, and it produces small, dry fruits known as cypsela. Peyritschia howellii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
